intro: Diplycosia soror var. nuda, commonly known as the naked sister diplycosia, is a variant of the Diplycosia soror species. It is a flowering plant belonging to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its simple, alternate leaves and showy, five-petaled flowers that typically bloom in summer. It is native to tropical and subtropical regions of the Americas. This variety is often cultivated for its ornamental value due to its vibrant floral display.
